website_summaries.verdict: This is an 18-inch cordless trimmer on a pole, which allows you to work on those tall shrubs.
pros: Since it's battery-powered, this trimmer can go anywhere you need to take it
With its 10' reach, you can trim areas you can't reach with regular units
The pivoting head makes it possible to work above, below, or even behind shrubs
cons: Because the product is used for long-reach work, it is top-heavy and rather cumbersome to use

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: Landscapers were going to charge $500 plus to cut my pool hedge. I cut my own hedge and saved money and was thrilled with the result. The edge is cedar and tall but with the ability to angle the cutting blade I could do most of the hedge from the ground and position a tarp under the cuttings for cleanup. There were some comments about the weight but I didn't have a problem with it and I'm a 5' 4" 70 year old woman.
customer_reviews.author: GDG

customer_reviews.title: This B&D unit is built stronger and works better. As others have noted
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the Green Works version of this hedge clipper. It lasted for about 9 minutes and was returned to Amazon. I was hesitant about ordering a similar product but decided to take a chance. This B&D unit is built stronger and works better. As others have noted, it is heavy. But it cuts well and stood up to my trying to cut a wire fence a couple of times, with no damage. I am able to get through 6 or 8 small bushes and two 6ft bushes without the battery getting depleted. The angled head allows both overhead and ground level cutting which is quite convenient at times.
customer_reviews.author: Sundowner

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The balance is way off and your arms will get tired holding it up after a while. It doesn't have enough angles on the head (only up, 45 and 90 degrees) so it makes it hard to get to the very back of the hedge. Worst is the cutting action. I spend most of my time with it watching it push down the leaves just to watch them pop right back up again. I wish I would have returned it in the 30 days. I have a full set of B&D cordless tools and this is the only one I'm genuinely disappointed with.
customer_reviews.author: adriane sims

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to operate and is more powerful than we anticipated
customer_reviews.text: So far we've trimmed some very tall arbor vitae and some dogwoods. It is easy to operate and is more powerful than we anticipated, making the task seem like no work at all. The ability to change angles allows us to reach exactly where we want to trim. We wish we'd gotten this years ago and saved all kinds of difficulties climbing ladders, reaching for impossible distances, etc. With this tool, it is a pleasure to keep our shrubs looking their very best. No ladders needed now, and for a couple of older folks, that's a great safety feature!
customer_reviews.author: embecker

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to other 1-star reviews!
customer_reviews.text: I love Black and Deckers other cordless tools, and have their (regular hedger), pole-chainsaw and leaf blower. I would give them all 5-stars. But this one is a loser. I simply can’t get it to cut anything, or at least ‘very few thjngs’. It’s less headache to get a ladder and use my regular length Black and Decker cordless hedger.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Black + Decker pole hedge trimmer cuts well
customer_reviews.text: This adjustable angle pole hedge trimmer has worked well for me, during the two hours or so I've used it. I already had two of the 20 volt batteries that I bought for other B + D lawn care machines, so the hedge trimmer was not very expensive. I do agree that this machine is a bit heavy and not well balanced ( delicate persons take note) but the adjustable features make it exactly what I needed . It does cut through 1/4 to 3/8 inch diameter hedge branches quickly. Thicker branches will require a different device.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great for weight-lifting exercise
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect too much. First one ordered conked out in 30 minutes. Replacement still works, but... It's very top heavy, so holding it up for with stretched arms any length of time requires some muscle and endurance. The angle adjustment feature is pretty much useless for tall hedges. Hard to switch on while also getting the safety lock disengaged. For the size and weight of the motor you'd expect somewhat heavier blade. Battery life is good. My arms are usually worn our before the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Sirned

customer_reviews.title: your armed and dangerous in the yard with this thing
customer_reviews.text: lol .. i used this baby all last season to fight back the jungle on the one side of my yard i planted with hedge plants and let go to fill in .. you'll have to manually cut out the bigger stuff initially but after that, zip tie the trigger and go make a pile to clean up .. this makes it easy even if things are tall .. it seems to be holding up ok so far, i actually bought a second battery for it although i rarely need it, she goes a long way .. you'll have a serious mess to clean up if you need more than one battery haha ...
customer_reviews.author: B. Seals

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: You can imagine how a hedge trimmer on a pole might work. You can angle the trimmer from the pole - although it needs to have a couple of additional angles - and then you can trim lower to the ground or taller bushes. The "balance" of the design is not ideal because the trimmer is heavy and the pole extends out several feet, but the battery lasts for a reasonable amount of time (bring 2-3 batteries with you for a larger project). If you are going to buy a pole trimmer, this is as good as you could hope for since it is reasonably priced and uses the standard B&D 20v lithium.
customer_reviews.author: Strong Reader

customer_reviews.title: A great working but rather heavy pole trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great took for trimming tall or deep bushes. My only negative comment is that it is rather heavy. I could not use it for an extended amount of time. Fortunately I don't have a lot of tall bushes. I use a hand held, lighter regular trimmer for my other bushes. Being battery powered makes it much easier to use because I didn't have to drag a cord around. I would buy this trimmer again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: pvic

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent cordless pole hedge trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cordless pole hedge trimmer. It’s relatively light, but very sturdy, and does a fine job trimming hedges. I held off for awhile buying this, hoping that Black & Decker would come out with a 40V MAX model since the batteries would be compatible with my other B&D gear, but they didn’t so I finally decided to get this 20V MAX model. It probably worked out better this way, as a 40V MAX model would likely be heavier and harder to handle. This one is just what I needed, has good cutting capability and battery power, and good reach. Another fine B&D product!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fredericksen

customer_reviews.title: Midget to Giant
customer_reviews.text: I'm almost a Midget, but this telescoping pole trimmer makes me feel like a giant. I can now trim bushes I didn't know existed... Easy to use (not ungainly) ...No more gas or electrical cords...."What a pleasure to use". And I can use the existing 20v batteries from my other cordless power tools. This one is a WINNER folks. Joe D.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Made life easier
customer_reviews.text: As a 72 year old, trimming the top of our large mountain laurel was quite a chore. Getting all the way to the middle while standing on a ladder pressed up against the sides and reaching as far as I could with our regular size electric trimmer was the only way to reach it. With this trimmer, I can just stand on the ladder and reach the middle without all the struggle. It did a great job of trimming the branches, and was so much easier and faster that I had plenty of time left to sit and enjoy a cold drink.
customer_reviews.author: MPB

customer_reviews.title: This trimmer is heavy!
customer_reviews.text: Well!!!! The reviews I read before I purchased this item were spot on! This hedge trimmer is durable, with a decent battery life. It seems to be sturdy, with a nice battery pack & charger. It can be maneuvered to cut at a 90 degree, which is great if you have tall hedges. Now for the negative! This thing is heavy. If you are cutting shrubs higher than you are tall, then your arms better be in great shape, otherwise, you’ll have to take breaks. Maybe I am a little out of shape too. Anyway, overall, this B&D trimmer is well worth the price! I would certainly recommend it to anyone with light yard work!
customer_reviews.author: MrsMcMillan

customer_reviews.title: Good for what its made for.
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, it's awkward with all the weight at the end. However, I found that all that weight actually made it easier sometimes because I could let the weight do the work. It works fine on thinner stuff, maybe up to 3/8". Thicker than that it doesn't cut very well. Hard to say how well it will hold up, it does seem a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: rjones35

customer_reviews.title: Great reach but can be heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great reach but is heavy. this product is well made and performs as promised. The only downside is that this can get very tireing due to the weght at the end of the pole. That isn't necessarily a huge negative, rather it is a function of physics, the motor at the end of the pole is going to get heavy. If you can live with that like I have it is great. I have ivy covered cinder block fence walls, the ivy is 10 feet high. I can trim it all in about 1/4 the time is used to take vs a regular hefgr trimmer and ladder. Just be prepared for sure shoulders
customer_reviews.author: Jim V

customer_reviews.title: This Is Good but Heavy
customer_reviews.text: I like the cordless Black and Decker hedge trimmer but it is a lot heavier than I thought it would be and therefore less maneuverable. It does a very good job of cutting and is plenty powerful; and the battery life is good. It does not extend telescopically like I thought it did. What you see is what you get. In the end I am pleased to add it to my other tools.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dale Capehart, Church

customer_reviews.title: Reaches high but will make your arms ache.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it reaches high areas on shrubs. I don’t like the weight of it. They must have made the motor out of lead. I think I have average arm strength for a man my age but this trimmer is painful for me to use. My wife won’t use it at all. At least i will use it for areas I can’t reach without a ladder and use a regular trimmer for the reachable areas. So I think it is a good trimmer to use along with regular style trimmers but wouldn’t want it for my only trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Jack of All

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and clumsy, but serves a purpose
customer_reviews.text: I have a BLACK+DECKER LHT2436 from a few years back that I'm extremely happy with. And so I thought to go with B+D for something with reach. I guess this trimmer accomplishes what I needed... but it's HEAVY and clumsy. Plus the bar itself is quite flimsy and did not come with a sheath for storage. This is nowhere near the quality of my LHT2436 (which I will continue to use for most jobs), but when extended reach is needed this gets that one job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Fabulous

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker doesn't even know its own products!
customer_reviews.text: This review has to do with just the content of this product. I was expecting the blade to have some sort of sheath, just like the one that came with the regular Black and Decker hedge trimmer I purchased not long ago. Also when I asked if the product came with its own carrying bag, a Black and Decker rep answered and said that it did, which is absolutely not true. It is a shame that neither of those two needed items are included in the box. Very disappointed and the two missing stars of this review are one for each of the needed items that are not included with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bethzaida Crespo

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of one of these. The first one I had lasted 10 years. This one has a 20 v battery that is a lot smaller than the old one that had an 18 v battery. Otherwise it's the same. I use it to trim a 6 ft tall hedge that is 75 feet long. I can trim the whole hedge on one charge. I considered a gas powered trimmer but this electric one is lighter and easy to use,
customer_reviews.author: halskis

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great and ran a surprisingly long time on a single battery. It can't handle larger branches, but that's to be expected. I can't move quite as quickly as with a corded trimmer, as it can get bogged down a little, but I don't have to slow down too much. It worked great on Forsythia and Lilac bushes. I used it in multiple orientations and it never got unwieldy. The extended reach is very useful, both above my head, and extending out over a wide shrub. This actually works better than I expected to so I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Buser

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome !!  IF YOU HAVE THE MUSCLE TO USE IT
customer_reviews.text: Best tool for the job Seriously,, Dont even need a ladder to get the top off the bush! I hold it in a way that wont hurt my back and get the job done. Then hurting the next couple days. AND it keeps the blades away from you and NO cord Its about 5 feet long and stays that way,, DOES NOT Shorten, pictures are kind off deceiving the end can be changed to a 45 or 90 angle. I think its one of the best tools I have ever seen ,and it works GREAT Even cut off a 1/2 in branch or bigger
customer_reviews.author: wiles

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the hard to reach stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Although this trimmer is heavier than expected it does the job. Its great for light work that is tricky to get to. The blades are smaller then my 18 volt B and D trimmer but it will cut. Just what i was looking for, for the tall hedges I have. The 20 volt battery makes a big difference as well. My 18 volt trimmer does not hold a charge for very long. I think the new 20 volt tools from B and D are very good. Wish you made a vacuum cleaner that uses this same battery! Also, the price point is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: John Ehlers

customer_reviews.title: More than we thought we were getting.
customer_reviews.text: Husband ordered thinking he was only getting the extended attachment to use on his saw. This came with the pole and extension too which was more than we'd thought we were getting. We are able to use our other black and decker battery packs on this.
customer_reviews.author: teche

customer_reviews.title: It’s heavy after awhile of using it.
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this hedge trimmer- but get ready for an arm and shoulder workout. It is heavy and can be tiring if you are using it for the whole battery life. I think it would be better with a handle like the weedwacker from B&D.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Furness

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cut
customer_reviews.text: I am in need of this type of product and have the lithium batteries for other Black & Decker tools. The assembly was easy. However, it doesn't cut! I tried this on 3 different hedges I have and it barely cut off leaves much less very thin branches. I immediately packed it and sent it back. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this and was extremely happy with its performance! I was easily able to cut through brush and trim up a much oversized bush in our front yard. I wasn't expecting it to do near the job that it did! Battery life wasn't that great but that's because I only had a 1.5mah battery available. I am sure it wouldn't be a problem with a larger battery. I would gladly recommend this item to anyone needing a extended trimmer!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good product from Black & Decker
customer_reviews.text: Good idea and design. Can trim our tall hedges on a slope more easily than ever before. No need for time-consuming, tedious trimming with a pair of shears and a pole trimmer manually. Wish that we bought it long time ago. Recommend (Note: you do not have to be a body builder with bulky biceps to use it; just rest when feeling tired; do not try to over-reach and lose balance). Wear a pair of wrist splints to prevent tendinitis. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Careful buyer

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: The battery makes it versatile but very heavy on the bottom. Good for use on young plants or edges where the limbs aren't very heavy. Doesn't cut through even small twigs because it doesn't have the power. Be careful when Adjusting the direction of the cutting head. It can flip either direction and can fall back and hit you in the wrist. Of Course- turn it off first.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Richie

customer_reviews.title: Top heavy
customer_reviews.text: The unit works great assembly was easy and powerful enough for the job. I’ve trimmed my box hedge. Tall juniper, hibiscus bushes and lemon tree the only draw back is balance when trimming items that are high you are holding the unit at the end and now it’s too heavy. And yes you could use a latter but that’s why I purchased the pole trimmer to have have to worry of falling. Again the unit work great but maybe someone could look into the balance of the trimmer. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Guadalupe Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Very ineffective cutting.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that I could use it on at least some of my shrubs. It's almost completely ineffective. I expected trouble with some of my larger branched, older bushes but it could barely handle boxwoods and holly bushes. The unit would either get stuck in mid cut or else it would take what seemed like an eternity to cut through a branch. I'm talking about stuff that was barely 1/8th of an inch. Thankfully I got the unit without the battery (since I have the 20 volt blower) but this is pretty much $70 down the drain. I hope I still have the boxes so I can return it.
customer_reviews.author: ReagansDad

customer_reviews.title: Good hedge trimmer for average use around the yard
customer_reviews.text: Pros: does the job cuts through fairly easily. Easy to assemble & operate. Great for average trimming around the yard. Cons: a bit heavy on the handle end with battery & all. But most ppl should be able to handle it The battery included didnt run that long so probably get an extra battery & a quick charger. It doesn't extend any further than you see so if they are tall hedges may want to by one that extends.
customer_reviews.author: Tutonia

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: I also used the extension from my BD pole saw to give the timmer an extra 3 feet. I did have to make the slight modification to the extension that come with the pole saw. Grind off the ridge on the extension that only fits the BD pole saw. The trigger handle works for both. I now have two triggers one with the extension and one without.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Handy addition to the gardening tools that makes for safer tall hedge trimming
customer_reviews.text: We have a tall privacy hedge lining the driveway and it was very difficult to trim with a handheld hedge trimmer (picture my husband in the bed of the pickup truck trimming the top while I drove very slowly up the driveway). With this pole trimmer, my husband can easily reach the top and we no longer have to resort to the unsafe bed-of-the-pickup-truck method. Thank you Black and Decker!
customer_reviews.author: SusanF

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to trim my 12 foot tall bottle brush trees. I still need to use a ladder, but this unit provides more capability to reach the top. The ability to adjust the angle helps a bunch. I've also used to trim items lower to the ground without having to bend down. It's battery powered so it's not as powerful as my corded trimmer, but for lighter weight jobs it works well. It is top heavy, so it takes some effort to control, but it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: MOTU

customer_reviews.title: Ad. Is misleading as to height
customer_reviews.text: The ad. Says “ Useable length of 6-1/2 feet; effectively trims up to a height of 10 feet”. I guess if you are very tall & stretch high, the 10 feet is accurate. Otherwise both of these numbers are quite exaggerated. So if you are shorter than average or have short arms, I hope you are not planning to trim the top of high hedges.
customer_reviews.author: Slayda

customer_reviews.title: Convenience of 20 v li ion long lasting battery system
customer_reviews.text: I also have BD blower, trimmer and power tools. While not as powerful as its gas rivals, the convenience far outweighs this shortcoming. No more gas puchases, pouring, spilling, starting and polluting of my former gas lawn tools. The 20 v system is same as my BD power tools so I now have so many backup batteries for both lawn and shop work that I never run out of "gas" for any job.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Chao

customer_reviews.title: Works good on small diameter branches only
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy but it only takes on small size branches. It is a bit heavy on the hands and then change of angle feature is nice. It really doesn't work well it for for larger branch hedges although it would cut boxwoods all day long. The teeth are just too small. However, much sturdier feeling than the Greenworks model. It is a trade off. I am on my second Greenworks and was hoping this would be a good replacement, as the first Greenworks fell apart after a year, but honestly I am better off nursing that model since it cuts all hedge sizes. Maybe I just need to buy a gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Black & Decker Pole Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The adjustable angle on the head is useful, and, of course, the extra pole height will keep most of us with our feet on the ground and off of ladders. It clips reasonably well, but does not cut through 7/16" as described. Expectations should be lowered to 3/8" or less and it seems to perform well. As an afterthought - the product should be designed for use without a pole, thus offering it as a more versatile regular trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Weight is an issue
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine... I would give it a better rating if it weren’t for the difficulty in using it for an extended period because of the weight. It is heavier than expected and since the majority of the weight is in the front it wears you out in a short period of time.. If the electric Moyer was closer to the handle it would be fine or if they made some sort of harness to help maneuver it that might help. So functionally it works well to trim but maneuvering it because of the weight you may want to consider that
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Extended Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Love this trimmer for a lot of very tall bushes. It saves me so much time and the battery lasts till the job is done. It does take a little arm and shoulder strength for horizontal trimming but it works great and saves me time as I can cover a large area from one spot. So far the battery holds plenty of juice to handle all my shrubs and bushes. If you have very tall bushes - this is a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: works well, a little awkward to get used to.
customer_reviews.text: It certainly helps me reach some things I could not before, but it doesn't come without some effort! It is nice to be able to set it at different angles, it makes it easier to get a nice line when squaring off a shrub. I have both this and the shorter hedge trimming model and I thought it would double my reach but without a little more upper body strength it only gets me so far. Time to lift some damn weights haha.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life !
customer_reviews.text: Super impressed with this trimmer. I was expecting to have to buy extra batteries as the included looked small but was delighted to have it last through four 20ft tall Oleander trees. Was still going strong at the end. I'd have liked a larger cutter but it was able todo 3/8inch branches easily. A nice buy
customer_reviews.author: M. Hackett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Tall Shrubs!
customer_reviews.text: I just added this trimmer to my collection of Black and Decker 20 volt yard tools. It does a very good job of trimming my tall shrubs. It does get a little top heavy when I’m standing on the ladder and reaching the taller ones. Overall, I am very happy and would recommend this extended trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: LER North Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Great for hard to reach places.
customer_reviews.text: It is heavy if you are reaching out away from you but that is to be expected. Has helped me reach those hard to reach places I couldn’t in the past. I use my other trimmers when I can reach the bushes. Not as powerful as my trimmers without extension pole but I am happy overall with these.
customer_reviews.author: jroach

customer_reviews.title: would pass on this
customer_reviews.text: After reading various reviews of this type of extended reach pole trimmer, I decided to go ahead and order it.........it does a fairly effective job of trimming shrubs and hedges that have relatively thin branches however found it would lock up on basically anything approaching 1/2 inch thick branches and its biggest shortcoming is the weight. I am a generally fit 79 year old male that has a lot of stamina but when you stand on a ladder to gain an extra 4 to 5 feet of reach with this, it is overwhelming!
customer_reviews.author: shaverman

customer_reviews.title: Meet the Future
customer_reviews.text: The 20V lithium Ion system is so much better than the old 18V Nicad system. First you can re charge the 20V with half a charge . Do that on the old Nicad, and you leave a memory, that will prevent you fully charging the battery again. Second, the Lithium batteries last much longer, and recharge faster. Don't stock up on extra 20V batteries this year, I guarantee you next year's battery will be even better.
customer_reviews.author: David F.Ewart

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended if you need to trim tall shrubs
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, really helps trimming tall shrubs. Powerful. Battery life great. My only recommendation is that the head angle be fully adjustable rather than 0, 45, and 90 degrees. This hasn't provene to be a big problem, but would make the tool a little easier to use in some situations. I still rate at 5 stars. I own several of the 20V LiIon tools now. All work really well. This is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Better have strong wrists and arms
customer_reviews.text: Ok for smaller branches. Top heavy design does a number on your wrists, shoulders and arms. For big jobs, go with GAS. Could be better if the ON switch could be SET to ON, without having to hold it down the whole time you are working. Then you could free up a hand/arm to better support this trimmer. Guess its a safety issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Goudoras

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I have three large shrubs that are so tall that even with a latter it was really hard to reach the top center of each shrub to trim. I was able to trim all three today and still had battery life left. They all look better than they ever have and I am really pleased with this trimmer. It is sturdy and the cutting power is excellent. It cuts through the shrub branches like they are butter. When I completed the job I sprayed the blades with silicone to keep them from rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Salch

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be 40V
customer_reviews.text: I have a 40V B&D hedge trimmer that I love. This 20V pole trimmer can’t get through the same thicker branches as the 40V. Unfortunately my hedges are too tall & require a telescoping pole to reach or I’d just use the regular trimmer. And, as some have mentioned, it’s not well balanced. Waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: volksmarchge

customer_reviews.title: needs redesign
customer_reviews.text: generally work OK if you just use it for 5 or 10 minutes work. but if the job take longer time, you's better be muscled enriched on your arms. one hand must hold the trigger, there is no lock function. maybe for safety consideration. but the trimmer has to be raised in a very inefficient way, your energy will get quickly consumed before the battery. :(
customer_reviews.author: speeder

customer_reviews.title: Works great for those hard to reach places
customer_reviews.text: Lots of adjustability and length to get to most of what you want to. One more extension piece might be nice but you would get tired rather quickly holding it up. A longer blade would have also been nice but I knew what it was before I purchased. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Pankratz

customer_reviews.title: Everyday functional
customer_reviews.text: It does the job, but does take some practice to use it. It’s not quite as functional,as I’d like it to be, but Im Trying to use it on blackberry bushes. It works terrific on lightweight grasses and bushes. It works well to get large areas chopped down. It’s lightweight, I like that. But it would be nicer if it were just a little more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Thayer

customer_reviews.title: Very Weak. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used 20 volt battery B&D hedge trimmers For years and decided to get these for hard to reach places. Bad move. These are very weak. They do not cut anything except very small branches. Guess I should’ve known judging by the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Addington

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product.....a time saver!
customer_reviews.text: Works great cutting the hedges on trees and shrubs. Saves a bunch of time, and makes the chore a breeze. Kind of wished it could be used sometimes without the extension. The Extension helps me take a level whack at the shrubs...as I can stand a little further back and move the trimmer parallel to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: MrD

customer_reviews.title: I used it for about 45 minutes and the battery was still carrying a good charge. The only "problems" are that it's a ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding. It cut cleanly and quickly and moved through overgrown forsythia with ease. I used it for about 45 minutes and the battery was still carrying a good charge. The only "problems" are that it's a bit awkward to use when cutting bushes that are within reach, and claims of a 10' reach are ridiculous. If you fully extend the trimmer in one hand, you might get a good 8' out. But I'm in pretty good shape and found it difficult to extend like that for an extended period of time. Your shoulders will wear out quickly and you lose precision. If not for the 10' claim, I would have given this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Murr

customer_reviews.title: Not practical.
customer_reviews.text: There are two major defects in this units design: 1. The motor is in the head resulting in a very uncomfortable balance/weight. Not only is the weight excessive at arms length, but trying to hold out that weight while putting enough lateral pressure on to actually cut the hedging, is no easy feat. One the pro side, the muscles in my forearms have grown significantly since getting this! 2. At 7/16-inch, the pitch of the blades is very small so it can only trim the smallest of branches - counter to what most large hedges needing a unit like this would actually have. Bottom line is that this trimmer is simply not a practical tool for cutting most large hedges.
customer_reviews.author: S.Cutter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Pole Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer is light enough to handle a full day's work of major trimming on creeping type vines. Biggest challenge is the batter does not last all day, but, that was not expected so I purchased a back up battery. Battery chargers quickly.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. S., Jr

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time on this
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I bought this before the Spring & only charged it to see if it "worked". Too bad I didn't try it on one of the bushes I'd planned to trim with it. I used it today for the first time, or at least I tried to... it wouldn't even cut a branch that was only about a 10th of an inch thick- it was basically useless. And it weighs so much it's very awkward & cumbersome, especially since all it does is rip some branches & then jam up. Don't bother with this one. The only thing it cuts is your budget since it's a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sandrascats

customer_reviews.title: Very useful but.....
customer_reviews.text: This item is very useful for projects that don't involve a long time. However, your arms do get tired over time if using this for really tall shrubs. That said, it's still a really good additional tool, kind of a lifesaver sometimes. I just don't use this for shorter shrubs. I use the 20V regular Black & Decker hedge trimmer for those.
customer_reviews.author: RobertSC

customer_reviews.title: Sent in a box with no paperwork
customer_reviews.text: Have not tried it yet, but it was put in a box, not even in a Black and Decker box, with no padding, no paperwork such as , instructions, warranty papers, etc . Just put in an empty box, not what I expect from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Doug Roth

customer_reviews.title: It cuts good
customer_reviews.text: Other than that it is a little on the heavy side. Not quite as long as the picture makes out to be. It's kind of hard to use on a ladder because it is a bit top heavy. But is does cut good and the battery does last pretty good. I would not recommend it for kids or wimpy old men.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Black & Decker Workout/Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Hedge trimmer was easy to assemble out of the box and the battery charged quickly. This trimmer operates well and trims bushes, small trees branches and bamboo without much trouble. The biggest negative with the overall design was the weight of the unit. With the addition of the pivoting section(which functions properly), the trimmer is too heavy for most people to use. I am a big guy and use string trimmers and chainsaws with ease...this unit would be almost impossible for smaller people or elderly to use. Blade sections also bend easily, which is a problem with something so awkward to handle.
customer_reviews.author: L O

customer_reviews.title: Cheap tool, but works great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using for light commercial work for about 2 months now. Works great for the price. It is a bit heavy when holding up/out from body but I don’t see how that can be unexpected when putting a power tool on the end of a pole. When this one does I’ll definitely buy the same to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: josh schultz

customer_reviews.title: Works great- very powerful-lightweight-flexible
customer_reviews.text: I admit I was surprised at the power and flexibility of this 20v extension hedge clipper. Very light for its reach and very easy to adjust the clipper angle. I was able to easily trim the top of shrubs off squarely which I could never get quite right even on a ladder. But with this one I safely on the ground. No cord to mess with. A perfect smaller yard trimmer. Honestly I wish I bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I have been using it for the last couple of months without any issues. It is light weight and convenient to use when trying to reach those tall shrubs or shrubs on a raised piece of ground... nice product...
customer_reviews.author: Tyrone R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Almost caught on fire! Poor quality, pass on this one.
customer_reviews.text: We finally got around to trimming our bushes today and we were very excited to try this product. Unfortunately, this product quickly failed on the first use. We didn't even fully discharge the battery before the motor burnt up emitting lots of smoke. Looks like we just missed the amazon return window by 2 days. My advice is to pass on this one and purchase a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: FinalResort

customer_reviews.title: cut tiny branches with a heavy head
customer_reviews.text: As much as I need a trimmer with long reach, I return this trimmer without regret. CON: * only cut tiny size branches (reason for returning) * heavy head (I will still keep it if it can do cutting like this one:  ) PRO: * long pole
customer_reviews.author: Vince Le

customer_reviews.title: Would be nicer if it telescoped but otherwise, solid
customer_reviews.text: This thing mowed down some thick holly bush branches like a boss. The only thing I don't really like about it is how big it is. It doesn't really come apart for storage that easily. But it's nice to be cordless with power and that kind of extension arm. I wish it telescoped.
customer_reviews.author: Baron of Colier

customer_reviews.title: Great Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is just what I needed. I use it to trim my Bottle Brush bushes and trees. The blade angle feature allows me to achieve the cutting angle needed to give a round appearance, especially on the trees. The battery power saves time, it is quicker than using the 50 ft extension cord
customer_reviews.author: D.M.C.

customer_reviews.title: Trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: Always had good luck with B & D products . This one works great for those high areas so I don't have to get the ladder out. Only negative is it can be a bit top heavy (unbalanced ) for long time use .
customer_reviews.author: t s

customer_reviews.title: Great product -gets rid of ladders
customer_reviews.text: Only dislike was that was a little heavy for extended use
customer_reviews.author: TOM R.

customer_reviews.title: Good power to weight ratio
customer_reviews.text: Good power to weight ratio. Good balance of weight to duration of battery... we always want a battery to last forever, but the trade-offs were well balanced in this device. Good reach. The only draw back is that the connectors between the grip and the motor head and the extension are a screw type that comes undone with some amount of standard usage vibration. So, I have to check to make sure it's solidly connected about every battery change. If I don't check it, the device starts to be sporadic in running... typical faulty connection behavior, but gives the impression of a dead battery or semi-burned out engine. Tightening the connectors again and it runs like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Power and Endurance
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer has plenty of power, and I trimmed all my hedges without any battery fade. The one drawback is that the head is quite heavy, so it's difficult to maintain control from the opposite end of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: dcg

customer_reviews.title: Good Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I already had some 20v batteries so I purchased without the battery. For the price its great, seems to cut as well as my plug in electric trimmer. The pole is good for reaching into and up high on bushes. This trimmer will probably cut down on the amount of time I need to spend trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I am a newly divorced 57 year old woman that has NEVER done yard work. I had been borrowing a smaller edger that has a cord, and well after edging through several cords, I knew I needed something else. This edger is sooooo light and easy to handle! The battery is wonderful and lasts a long time, and the edger is not loud at all. I have many tall trees and bushes and I am able to chop them down quickly and efficiently. I would definitely recommend the product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Reliable B&D Tool
customer_reviews.text: One of the reasons I like the Black & Decker trimmer is that the battery is the same as my other B & D yard tools. I've found these tools to be very durable and reliable. The one thing I am not fond of with this trimmer is that it's a bit heavy and awkward to use.
customer_reviews.author: wbstrick

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, even with batteries from other Black+Decker tools
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed that this is not adjustable so that you can use it without the long handle, which is the only reason I didn't give it a 5/5. Otherwise, it works well for its intended purpose and being able to reuse batteries from other 20V B+D products is great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Head

customer_reviews.title: Works great; not extendable, a little long for short folks
customer_reviews.text: Works great! The battery lasted through a full morning of pruning without showing signs of slowing down. My two complaints are that there's no way to 'collapse' the tool to make it a non-pole trimmer, and that for me, if I was supporting the tool near the center of mass with one hand, I couldn't reach the trigger with my other hand without some contortion (I'm 5'2"). Also, the ability to angle the head is nice, but because there's no real handle on the pole, you have to apply a lot of torque to keep the head from rotating towards the ground. Overall though, I'm quite pleased with this, it definitely gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Brownell

customer_reviews.title: This cutter is amazing, sturdy but not overly heavy and
customer_reviews.text: Our days of trying to trim shrubs and bushes while also trying to balancing on a ladder are over. This cutter is amazing, sturdy but not overly heavy and, with the swiveling cutting head and the excellent battery power is the difference between trimming your own shrubs and having to hire someone. We loaned ours to a neighbor and he is now ordering one also. We've had other Black and Decker trimmers, have had good experience with each of them but, this one is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S

customer_reviews.title: Nice trimmer
customer_reviews.text: This works great for those tall hedges that you need to stand on your tip toes to cut the top. Does the job, but the weight distribution is still a bit awkward and tiresome for the arms quickly.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Love this. I also got a trimmer/edger that works ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I also got a trimmer/edger that works on the same batteries. The length of this is a blessing and a curse. Pro: I can reach up quite high, and the angle adjustment is great for getting the tops of my shrubs cut correctly. But the length also tires you out, since every action involves moving this long stick around. I am ambidextrous (can use both hands) so i just switch back and forth, but if I wasn't, I doubt I could last more than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I am 47 year old female that does all the outside trimming. This is Awesome tool!. No more ladder for me with my hedger. I can safely trim my high hedges from the ground now. Loving it!
customer_reviews.author: debbie rattray

customer_reviews.title: my hedge looks like a 4 yr old tried to trim it
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. Too heavy at the end. Impossible to use horizontally for more than a couple of minutes. my hedge looks like a 4 yr old tried to trim it. I will get one without the pole and use a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie E.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in three months
customer_reviews.text: It is a little heavier to use than I expected, otherwise it performed well.........until today. I started to notice an electrical odor just before it quit. It ran intermittently briefly when I tilted the head, then gave out altogether. Not at all happy that it only lasted three months. I will attempt to have it repaired locally under warranty at an authorized agency, but I am not holding my breath. At least I got through the summer season with it. Always had good luck with B&D products in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R.

customer_reviews.title: Light Duty
customer_reviews.text: I am a little disappointed with the quality but it is a homeowners item and I usually buy professional yard equipment. I bent the blade but was able to straighten it with no harm done. The battery lasts as long as I need to use it. Addendum The unit has failed after four battery cycles ( about 2 hours). It runs for half a minute then shuts down. I have to take back two stars. Addendum: Black and Decker took back the product as it had a 2 year warranty and replaced it with a different product at my request.
customer_reviews.author: Samwise

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was lighter and just a bit more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a goor product and does the job you intend it to. Being mostly plastic I don't think it is as rigid as it could be but it's a sharp effective product. I bought it because I have some hard to reach areas to trim and this was the only thing reasonably priced enough for me to be able to reach. Having said that - unless you are trimming straight up then the balance on this is way off. It's like trying to hold a weight up at the end of a long stick and gets tiring FAST. I like the product but it is cumbersome to use.
customer_reviews.author: tbirdpj

customer_reviews.title: Hedge Trimmer Builds Upper Body Strength
customer_reviews.text: This hedge trimmer has worked quite well. I was surprised at just how well it trimmed things given that it was battery powered. Other reviews I read before purchasing the product noted that its only downside was that it wasn't well balanced. I found this to be true. The blade along with it's attached motor account for a lot of weight make longterm support somewhat of a challenge. If you take frequent breaks you will have no problems with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN3806

customer_reviews.title: beats fussing with the ladder
customer_reviews.text: yes, this is awkward to balance, but not as awkward as re-positioning a ladder every 5 minutes. I feel like it could benefit from some kind of shoulder strap, but my cutting was done before it got too bad -- it goes much quicker with this..
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this trimmer and loved it. The new one even better. It is lighter due to the new lithium battery and also runs longer on a charge. The ability to change the angle of the cutting head is easier to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: Works well for trimming tall shrubs. Much safer than trying to use a hedge trimmer on a ladder. You do need decent arm strength to use it effectively. The pivoting head comes in handy for shaping tall shrubs at a 45 degree angle. It is also handy for trimming ground cover from a standing position.
customer_reviews.author: DMJ

customer_reviews.title: Lacks power, heavy, unsat
customer_reviews.text: Hedge trimmers are supposed handle any branch small enough for the blade gap. Or at least keep running so it can be extracted. Not this one. It bogs down and jams constantly on small branches well under the blade gap size and has to be wrestled free. Clips only the lightest branches. The weight of the cutting head and motor on the end of the pole also makes it quite tiring to use. The big storage duffel bag that comes with it is a silly waste; better to lower the price. At least I have a spare battery for the B&D 20V pole saw I bought at the same time; that's a great tool. I should investigate returning the trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: DWPC

customer_reviews.title: Interchangable Poles with 18v Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: I was a previous purchaser of the 18v Pole Chain Saw  and the nice thing is that the poles themselves are interchangeable (even though this is the Lithium version and the chain saw is not). For unknown reasons, the batteries are not interchangeable. I use this for some hedge trimming, but more for small brush clearing (which it does rather well). You should be aware that it's not exactly a lightweight piece of equipment to use and it can take a toll on your arms if you plan on working with it for hours.
customer_reviews.author: DavidCT

customer_reviews.title: Bushes Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome hedge trimmer! The pole makes getting to the tall bushes a breeze and the adjustable angle on the blade makes it even nicer. It is a little bit heavy when held at an angle, but it sure beats climbing up and down a ladder. The 20v lithium battery is super strong and runs right to the end as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: ~~Joe~~

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool but Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Works as it should. Not best ergo design. Have to be strong to use this tool. A bit heavier at motor end than expected. The weight puts lots of stress on arms and neck. Can only use for short time. But, it gets the job done. Just wish it were lighter.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great but needs handle!
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderfully on my ground cover junipers and tall grass type bushes that are a bear every fall but is a little unbalanced. I put a handle from my B&D string trimmer on the shaft and made it perfect for most any cutting angle. Got another handle replacement online. Would've made 5 stars if it came with that handle. Amazon also sells longer life batteries for this tool
customer_reviews.author: Steve Charles

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Relatively light for a battery powered unit, battery lasts long enough to get a row of brush about 10 feet high above our 6 foot fence-by roughly 60 feet done. Still needed a 6 foot ladder to get the top, but is was nice only having to go about half way up the ladder and have plenty of reach. standing close to the top of a 12 foot ladder can be scary, especially when you have a gopher problem, and having to slide plywood scraps around with your ladder is a pain. Well worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great For Hard To Reach Trimming
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer is heavy and a bit unbalanced. That being said it as a tremendous reach and does a great job trimming. Saves lots of time having to climb a ladder. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Aquarius 204
